Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Claude Dallas lived the life of a cowboy. A loner and distrustful of authority, he lived off the land, poaching wildlife and selling the hides. But when two game wardens confronted Dallas about his deeds, they were shot and killed. After a massive manhunt, Dallas was captured and convicted, only to escape months later. Making the FBI's Ten Most Wanted list, Dallas eluded the law for almost a year until the FBI tracked him down in a small town in California.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, the decapitation of a young African-American male led the Miami-Dade police department and the FBI along a trail of murder. Investigators quickly discovered that the victim was a dissident member of a religious sect headed by a man calling himself Yahweh ben Yahweh, or God, Son of God. Although the FBI believed Yahweh ben Yahweh and his followers were responsible for many murders, they could find no direct evidence linking them to the crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A cunning predator was loose in rural South Carolinaabducting young women from their own front yards in broad daylight. He was also a sadist, calling one victim's family, taunting them, boosting and then dashing their hopes. Local investigators called on the FBI to help them find this clever serial killer. Like a game of chess, FBI profilers and forensic examiners were able to outwit the killer, and put an end to his deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 1992, masked bandits pulled off a daring mid-day bank robbery. It marked the beginning of a four-year crime wave that rocked Seattle. With each new robbery, the bandits perfected their craft, leaving behind no evidence and escaping with hundreds and thousands of dollars. As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When police in a small Washington State community began looking into the disappearance of a 22-year-old woman, they had no way of knowing it would evolve into a nationwide hunt for a sexual sadist. Police knew the killer's identity, but he was a master of disguise. The FBI was called on to help. Agents discovered that several unsuspecting women across the northwest had fallen prey to his charms.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A young mother and her infant son mysteriously disappeared from their home. The woman's husband was the only suspect, but he was eventually cleared. There was no solid evidence that a crime had even been committed. Six months later, a local farmer found the remains of the missing woman and her child. Both had been murdered. Agents and local police had only one tiny piece of evidence, an unidentified hair found in the murdered woman's car. The hair was too small for analysis.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a series of brutal bank robberies and murders in south Miami during the mid-1980's, the FBI embarked on an exhaustive eight-month investigation. With little evidence and no suspects, agents were willing to try anything to find the violent perpetrators. On April 11, 1986, agents conducting routine surveillance spotted the vehicle used in the bank robberies. They attempted to arrest the two suspects in the car. What followed was the bloodiest firefight in FBI history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 26, 1993, an explosion rocked the World Trade Center parking garage. Six people died and more than a thousand were injured in the bomb blast that tore a 5-story crater in the building. During the investigation, the twisted fender of a rental van was extracted from the rubble. The FBI was able to determine from where the van was rented and by whom. Undercover agents then made their arrests within six days of the bombing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a California man was found dismembered in 1990, police suspected a local burglar, but they couldn't find him. Six months later, he was caught robbing an Arizona bank and sentenced to life. But prison couldn't hold him for long, and within a year he escaped. The FBI would lead a multi-agency manhunt for a killer on a desperate run through the tourist regions of the west.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1984, south Miami became the home for a sadistic serial killer. Posing as a fashion photographer, Christopher Wilder lured young women from shopping malls with promises of fame and fortune. Most ended up dead. As the FBI closed in around him, Wilder took off on a cross-country murderous rampage. The FBI added Wilder to their Most Wanted Fugitives program. The chase was on, and Wilder ultimately lost.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A cunning predator was loose in rural South Carolinaabducting young women from their own front yards in broad daylight. He was also a sadist, calling one victim's family, taunting them, boosting and then dashing their hopes. Local investigators called on the FBI to help them find this clever serial killer. Like a game of chess, FBI profilers and forensic examiners were able to outwit the killer, and put an end to his deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A serial killer's rampage was discovered when the bodies of several young women began turning up in shallow graves that dotted the Alaskan wilderness. The killer taunted his victims, hunting them like animals before shooting them down. He was at home in the rugged terrain. But the hunt for him began 3000 miles away, where FBI profilers mapped the criminal's mind.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A stranger snatched an eight-year-old girl as she played in her Tucson, Arizona neighborhood, leaving behind an abandoned bicycle and a frantic mother. Hundreds of citizens and police officers fanned out across the region, hoping to find some trace of the young girl or her abductor. Within hours, a suspect emerged; a drifter who was out on parole for abducting and molesting children. He was nowhere to be found and time had run out for the innocent child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: Celebrity Crime Files
programme.desc: The NFL has a drug problem. Nearly every week a new player is suspended for violating the leagues anti-drug policy. Players use supplements and PEDs to improve performance, marijuana to relieve the stress of a high-profile job and harder drugs, presumably, because they like to live the high life and can afford it. But why would an athlete earning millions in salary and endorsements run a drug operation during his precious down time? These are the stories of three men who werent satisfied with the riches they were earning from legitimate work and got busted trying to sling on the side, going from touchdowns to lockdown.

programme.title: Payback

programme.desc: Terrence George and Tiffany Durst were a promising couple from humble beginnings determined to make a prosperous life for themselves. programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Based in London, Francine Lacqua speaks with high-profile guests in the heart of global business, economics, finance and politics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Delivering the market-moving news anyone needs to know to get a jump start on the U.S. trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Technology
programme.desc: Technology is not only becoming an increasingly important part of people's lives but also of the American economy. "Bloomberg Technology" takes a look at how the latest happenings in the tech industry are affecting the U.S. markets. Analysis, commentary, interviews and interactive graphics are among the staples of the show that help viewers understand the impact the technology sector has on the economy. The show, which was originally titled "Bloomberg West," is anchored by Emily Chang in San Francisco.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Explore Outdoors: Spring Edition
programme.desc: Looking for things to do in Northern California? From the mountains to the sea, watch our Explore Outdoors special with recommendations for places to visit.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Hang with a viral sensation in his taxidermy workshop. Watch a bakery turn into a Burmese restaurant. Load up a picnic basket with chicken and dippity dips. Drink all the wines, and then sip on what a local calls a sober-up beer.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After a snowy day in Western Pennsylvania, a horrifying discovery leads investigators down a heartbreaking and twisted path. They'll seek swift justice for an innocent victim deceived.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Butter, burgers, bacon eggplant? There are many definitions of comfort food, but only one winner when Chef Keith Swiryn takes on Chef Garett Rodriguez in this classic dining challenge.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes people about real news stories with unreal outcomes for a chance to win money. In "Surprising Sights," contestants learn about a strange seal rescue, a bizarre landmark and a wild wedding prank.

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people and dozens of hours of news footage Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: In these real-life stories of the illicit drug trade, learn how law enforcement beats the smugglers in their high-stakes game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Recycled Percussion travels to Stillwater, Oklahoma to share some love with a single mom and her children who have fallen on hard times. Justin consoles the oldest daughter who recently moved in with her mom after living with her father for 10 years.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Having a little fun on the town is great but it's even better when you're doing it thriftily. Join Maddy & Dixie as they make a little cash go a long way, seeking out the best activities thatll have you ballin on a budget!

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Young, single, and new to Sacramento, Aurora knows what she wants and goes after it. Three Sacramento bachelors will try to win her over with a day of tango lessons, wood working and a jam session.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Discover a death-defying party trick, an ill mannered seagull, and the origins of the saying "know the ropes." This historic fishing town is Gloucester, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: These criminals may not have blood on their hands, but they still leave despair in their wake. From shady non-profits to fraudulent contractors, to wide-spread postal theft, here are some of the most devastating white-collar crimes to be attempted across the country.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From wacky gifts to seriously developed skills, talent is everywhere. This episode showcases the talents of people across the nation, young and old, and how they use these gifts for good.

programme.title: Farm to Fork: Growing a Movement
programme.desc: How cities are harnessing the power of agriculture to make real differences in the health and happiness of community members.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After a South Carolina couple vanishes, social media posts begin cropping up claiming the pair is fine and eloped. But their loved ones are convinced they're not the ones who penned the posts, and the truth is more shocking than anyone imagined.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes people in New Orleans about a starchy substance in a bathtub, animal mysteries and robots that do the darndest things.

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people and dozens of hours of news footage Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Escaping The Blade
programme.desc: Why California's sex traffickers are walking free while victims wait in fear and how organizations are fighting to protect survivors.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they wont give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Breaking Chains
programme.desc: Follow the journey of a sex trafficking survivor who makes her way through Change Court, a program that helps trafficking victims get off the streets, receive counseling, job training and get their criminal records expunged.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Kar is a selfless soul known for his unwavering commitment to the unhoused in his community. It's Kar's turn to have some good old-fashioned fun.

programme.title: Targeting An American Terrorist
programme.desc: American citizen Anwar Al-Awlaki is killed by a US drone strike after the once peaceful holy man joins the top ranks of Al Qaeda. Also, a vengeful accountant hopes to silence his wife.

programme.desc: Eric Rudolph sets off a bomb at the Atlanta Olympics, then launches deadly bombings at a southern abortion clinic and a gay bar. And, the life of a TV funnyman ends tragically.

programme.title: Murder By Mercedes
programme.desc: A prominent couple with a thriving dental practice ends up in a murderous love triangle when the family car turns into a deadly weapon. Also, a 911 call and a toy gun end in a tragic shooting at an Ohio Walmart.

programme.title: Real Estate Tycoon's Murder
programme.desc: When a car bomb kills an Arizona businessman outside a country club, investigators wonder if it's a mob hit, or an ex-wife out for cash. Also, a model's sexual con game turns into a deadly dinner.

programme.title: Killer Sunday School Teachers
programme.desc: An adulterous affair between two Sunday school teachers leads to a husband's murder. Also, a famous Bollywood stars claims he's innocent in the death of a homeless man.

programme.title: Double Murder Affair
programme.desc: When an affair heats up between a married man and a married woman, a husband and a wife are killed. And, a woman falls for a tennis pro whose life is built on lies and deceit that have deadly consequences.

programme.title: Runaway Bride
programme.desc: Police launch a massive manhunt when a bride-to-be disappears. Is it a crime or the wedding jitters? Also, a Mexican drug lord claims his cartel is a necessary evil that protects people from even bloodier rivals.

programme.title: Angel Of Death
programme.desc: When patients start dying unexpectedly at California hospitals, investigators wonder if it's natural causes or the work of an Angel of Death. And a bride-to-be uses a string of lies to escape her impending marriage.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From a football star equally comfortable at the rodeo, to a wrestler who created a custom mask to compete after a serious injury, these OKC athletes play sports on their own terms.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Let's "MEAT" today's chefs: BBQ Boss Chef Sam is looking to roast her competitor, Rotisserie Chef Joseph Burton, in today's game-day feast challenge. Which of these meat maestros will craft the ultimate game day spread?

programme.title: Hour Long Docs List
programme.desc: A playlist of hour long VL Originals

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Who says you can't go home again? The team travels back to where it all began to pay back the kindness they experienced 25 years ago when they first got started.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob takes the plunge with both old and new water-based activities, including paddleboard yoga, snowmobiling on the water, scuba diving and sailing.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The disappearance of 16-year-old JaRay Wilson spawns rumors of human trafficking in her small town in 2012. Investigators find her body and the truth, after an unlikely informant provides new details.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Where else can you pilot your own catamaran before ordering up a slice of sushi pizza? If thats not enough, you can also spend the night in a cozy barn, enjoy a cocktail at Funky Monkey and savor the mystery at Magical Meat Boutique.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Splish splash, will the would-be criminals take a bath? These wild stories wind up in bodies of water that you have to see to believe.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Why is Kansas City's fashion scene thriving? Craving a horchata latte? Best pizza on planet Earth? Local experts Jordan Gallant, Jasmine Green, and Aaron Rahsaan Thomas have all the answers, including where to go for a new hairstyle and a pep talk.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Charm City becomes Carb City in this bread-driven battle. Watch as chefs Ferhat Yalcin and Jonathan Hicks see who can carbo-load their way to victory.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: When homesick college student Miya Marcano books a flight to south Florida for the weekend, her family is thrilled. But when the plane lands, Miya is nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Every day, around the country, people with disabilities find opportunity, overcome the odds and fight for their rights. These stories show how members of the disabled community are not to be overlooked or underestimated.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan explores a beautiful orange grove while giving a tour on a school bus monster truck, pampers some pals at a European beer spa, and works the late-shift to make the best Philly cheesesteak outside the City of Brotherly Love.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Discover a death-defying party trick, an ill mannered seagull, and the origins of the saying "know the ropes." This historic fishing town is Gloucester, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Michael Ferrazzani, creator of Ya Mammas sauce, challenges the North End born Italian stallion, Chef Kenny Palazzolo, to a true neighborhood duel. Can Michaels Grandma inspired dish bring down the chef who lives, laughs and cooks Italian?

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel gets her sea legs with Maritime mogul, Captain Bobby LaPin. They sail Baltimore's iconic harbor, dive deep into the city's green initiatives, shuck oysters, and head out crabbing with the best seafarers Charm City has to offer.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Host Frank Nicotero visits "The Big Easy" armed with trivia questions about the unbelievable things people have seen in a bottle, under a church floorboard and even inside a mail truck!

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob tests out all types of relaxation, from sound baths to flinging an axe, discovers exciting new cuisine and quenches his thirst in this diverse and hopping Boston hood.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: From surfing the waves to surfing the shops, Justin and Ryan find a way to have both a good time and do a good deed in Oregon.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From paying ransoms to scouring hand-drawn treasure maps, these theft victims will do anything to recover their precious property.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Queen of Cupcakes Chef Sumayyah Bilal is up against Pound Cake King Tre-von Clark in this royal bake-off. Which chef will take the cake? And who will be burned by the competition?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Ivan Gomez is on a weight loss journey, but its one thats been limited to exercising in his home. Kinga meets Ivan in Stockton, CA to show him how the outdoors can be a personal gym for body, mind and spirit.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they wont give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: My Perfect Day

programme.title: Murder By Mercedes
programme.desc: A prominent couple with a thriving dental practice ends up in a murderous love triangle when the family car turns into a deadly weapon. Also, a 911 call and a toy gun end in a tragic shooting at an Ohio Walmart.
